result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd W Fredrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: COMPLY WTIH ANY COUNSELING RECOMMENDED BY THE AGENT

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd W Fredrick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd W Fredrick in court with attorney Richard G. Davis.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there is resolution today and asks the court to file the information after court which will be the same as the criminal complaint.  Atty Davis has no objection to that.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Hendee states that the parties are not requesting a PSI.  
Atty Davis states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing and wants to proceed.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant waives his right to a Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Court will allow the State to file the information after the hearing.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee is not requesting a PSI.
Atty Davis states that the defendant is not requesting a PSI.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts defendant's waiver of the PSI.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Davis asks the court to go along with the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Surcharge = $250.00
Comply with any counseling recommended by the Agent

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 30, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Letter from Atty Rich Davis dated 07-10-14 requesting plea and sentencing date
Cancelled Prelim.  mkv
Preliminary hearing on July 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Todd W Fredrick in court with attorney Richard G Davis.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.  
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Davis waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Prelim.

Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Atty Davis has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
